EmailTemplate.name: RE: Canceled: Abdullah Bozgeyik - MBO Partners Conversation (1341585784.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Canceled: Abdullah Bozgeyik - MBO Partners Conversation (1341585784.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Abdullah, Thank you for your follow up. What I mean by MBO does not support foreign employment at this time is, we cannot work with independent consultants that are non-US citizens working for non-US companies. When people reach out to MBO for information it is usually sign up to work with MBO. We provide an alternative to self-incorporation for independent consultants, where within our corporate structure we lower the administrative burden that comes along with being a consultant, including withholding of payroll taxes. Our consultants find all of their own work but run their billings through MBO and our systems are not set up to withhold any taxes other than US payroll taxes so we cannot support foreign employment. We have worked with independent consultants that are outside of the US but they have to be working with a US company and we can only pay them on a 1099 as a foreign sub, meaning we will not withhold any payroll taxes and it would be up to the consultant to manage that on their own. And to answer your question, to my understanding we do not have any clients/partners in Turkey. For a high level look at what MBO does for independents please watch this video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKDzwSTmGv4 <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKDzwSTmGv4> Please let me know if you have any additional questions. Thank you and have a great weekend!Nicolette From: Abdullah Bozgeyik [mailto:abozgeyik@yahoo.com] Sent: Friday, July 06, 2012 2:57 AM To: Nicolette Taylor Subject: RE: Canceled: Abdullah Bozgeyik - MBO Partners Conversation Hi Nicolette,
I see.. It is OK.. But what does "MBO does not support foreign employment at this point in time" mean?
Did you think that I applied for a job at your company?
My points at my previous message were basicaly 2 questions;
Do you have any MBO partner here in Turkey mainly in Istanbul?
I would like hear more about your services and possible contributions to a freelance consultant like me after 14 years of experience ?
Briefly I've been working as a frelance/independent consultant since 1998, plus my other professional hats.
So far what I understand is MBOpartners... does not have any partner in Turkey and MBO partners does not serve or cooperate with consultants outside of states..
Thanks. No, I do not have any more questions..
Have a great day.
Best wishes,
Abdullah Bozgeyik Bagimsiz Danisman (Freelance Consultant)
--- On Thu, 7/5/12, Nicolette Taylor <ntaylor@mbopartners.com <mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com>> wrote: From: Nicolette Taylor <ntaylor@mbopartners.com <mailto:ntaylor@mbopartners.com>> Subject: RE: Canceled: Abdullah Bozgeyik - MBO Partners Conversation To: "Abdullah Bozgeyik" <abozgeyik@yahoo.com <mailto:abozgeyik@yahoo.com>> Date: Thursday, July 5, 2012, 11:15 PMHi Abdullah, I apologize, I typed up an email earlier and forgot to hit send. In your inquiry that you specified that you are located outside of the US and unfortunately MBO does not support foreign employment at this point in time. If you have any questions please let me know. Thank you and have a great day, Nicolette From: Abdullah Bozgeyik [mailto:abozgeyik@yahoo.com] <mailto:[mailto:abozgeyik@yahoo.com]> Sent: Thursday, July 05, 2012 4:13 PM To: Nicolette Taylor Subject: Re: Canceled: Abdullah Bozgeyik - MBO Partners Conversation Hello Nicolette,
I could not see the reason for cancellation at the message.. ?
Best wishes,
Abdullah Bozgeyik Bagimsiz Danisman (Freelance Consultant) www.facebook.com/AbdullahBozgeyik <http://www.facebook.com/AbdullahBozgeyik> http://twitter.com/Abozgeyik <http://twitter.com/Abozgeyik> Skype: abdullahbozgeyik My Linkedin Groups: "Freelance Consultants of Turkey", "World of Freelance Consultants", "Turkish Companies Network" My Yahoo Groups: "CrisisManagementClass","CRMclass","EntrepreneurshipSBAclass" Articles/Yazilarim www.maxihaber.net <http://www.maxihaber.net> and www.google.com <http://www.google.com>
